A backpacker is a person who participates in backpacking. Backpacking is the outdoor recreation of carrying gear on one's back, while hiking for more than a day. It is often but not always an extended journey, and may or may not involve camping outdoors.
A backpack is a cloth sack carried on one's back and secured with two straps that go over the shoulders. It is a very popular way to carry things around.

Backpacking is a form of low-cost, independent travel. It includes the use of a backpack that is easily carried for long distances or long periods of time; the use of public transport; inexpensive lodging such as youth hostels; often a longer duration of the trip when compared with conventional vacations; and typically an interest in meeting locals as well as seeing sights.
A backpack is a bag that is carried on the back and secured with two straps that go over the shoulders.
A backpack is a piece of luggage carried on the back.

A backpack (also called rucksack, knapsack, packsack, pack, or sackpack) is, in its simplest frameless form, a cloth sack carried on one's back and secured with two straps that go over the shoulders, but there can be exceptions. Lightweight types of backpacks are sometimes worn on only one shoulder strap.
A backpacker is a person who is traveling on a long-distance journey, usually on foot.

The word backpack was coined in the United States in the 1910s. Moneybag and packsack were used prior, and now occur mainly as regionalisms.

The word backpack was coined in the United States in the 1910s. Moneybag and packsack were used prior, and now occur mainly as regionalisms. The word rucksack is a German loanword mainly used in the UK, US and in other Western military forces.
